text:
This is a mid tier restaurant, very comfortable with a good ambiance.

Waitress recommended a reasonably priced set RM328 set meal for our group of 5.

Set had chicken and pork stomach soup, Soy steamed groupa, prawn balls, double yam rings ( veggie and sweet sour pork), garlic fried vegetables Added a plate of fry beef hor fun.

The set was definitely worth the price for the sizable portion , taste, and quality.

Beef hor fun was on the high side at RM70 for large portion. Tea for 5 pax was RM25

Overall, it was an enjoyable dining experience. Will be back to try other dishes.

Recently changed menu, so we went down to try the new food. Ordered the 3-4pax menu. Food was actually much better than previously and portions are much bigger.
Definitely would go back again to try.

Golden Sands at Eco Botanic is a hidden gem that offers a delightful dining experience with a focus on authentic and flavorful Chinese cuisine. Located in the vibrant Eco Botanic area, the restaurant is a go-to spot for families, friends, and business gatherings alike. Here's a closer look at what makes Golden Sands stand out:

The restaurant's interior exudes a contemporary yet cozy charm, with warm lighting and tasteful decor. The layout is spacious, accommodating both intimate dinners and larger group settings. Its clean and welcoming atmosphere instantly sets the tone for an enjoyable meal.

Food
Golden Sands delivers on its promise of quality and authenticity. The menu is an impressive mix of traditional Chinese dishes and modern interpretations, ensuring there’s something for everyone.

For vegetarians, the tofu and vegetable options are equally well-prepared and satisfying.

Service
The staff at Golden Sands are attentive and friendly, always ready to recommend dishes or accommodate special requests. Service is prompt, ensuring that even during peak hours, diners are well taken care of.

Price
While Golden Sands leans towards the mid-to-high price range, the quality of the food and overall dining experience make it worth every penny. Portion sizes are generous, making it ideal for sharing.

Final thoughts
Golden Sands at Eco Botanic is a restaurant that excels in providing a harmonious blend of ambiance, quality, and service. Whether you’re celebrating a special occasion or just looking for a great meal, this spot is well worth a visit. A must-try for lovers of Chinese cuisine!

Great food, top notch service.
Pig stomach chicken soup above average, full of garlic fragrance. Green dragon stir fried surprisingly good! Must try.

First time tried this restaurant at Eko Botanic area. Serving Chinese dish mainly. Taste is mediocre and no wow effect to me. Price is definitely on the high side. The shrimp paste chicken wing is so small. Yam ring portion is rather small too. Not worth for the price we pay.
